Sound multibuffer granulation with signal form parameters and buffer based envelope.
â€‹
Grains are triggered either by signal zero-crossing or messages. Each grains can be individually panned on 1-2-4-6 or 8 outputs. This handles grains continuity when changing the buffer. Inputs can be signal or floats, even buffer selection.
Charles Bascou and Laurent Pottier Granular Buffer Multichannel
Trigger
Begin
Time position in milliseconds where the grain waveform is picked in the sound buffer.
Detune
transposition factor (ie. read speed) of the grain waveform. For example, 1. corresponds to original speed, 0.5 to lower octave, 2. to upper octave. Note that if the speed is negative the buffer waveform is read backward.
Name of the sound buffer stored by default in 0 position of the buffer list. Even if replaced later, this buffer has to be valid.
Name of the enveloppe buffer stored by default in 0 position of the buffer list. Even if replaced later, this buffer has to be valid.
1-2-4-6 or 8 outputs if specified. Default is 2.
Polyphonic voice number. Default is 512.
